documents.document: Be thankful we don't have delusional tulips like this in de Dail https://t.co/xAkej6e8Tp
@LFC @BurnleyOfficial Ah bollix
@Tanjamaar I think he's implying in an odd way that all the living VPs are there.

@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy What we fear is this service is being rushed through without proper planning, some woman is going to suffer badly because proper facilities are not in place for uncommon but not rare complications.
@Dr_RPM @astaines @HSELive Tis a cunning plan, as cunning as a fox with a degree in cunning from Cambridge University....
@Paschald I can mind it in my account if you want? #Resting

@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy GP a largely Pro choice cohort simply was a safe, secure and accessible servive. They feel its being pushed onto us as we are seen as a cheap easy solution rather than a safe good quality option (for this service)

@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy WHO say it can be delivered in the community by appropriately trained Doc/Midwives in properly equipped clinics. Despite what some have claimed they do not say it should be delivered by GPs.
@LunchtimeLiveNT @ciarakellydoc Yes and time should be a legislative issue not a constitutional one.
@HealthReformIRE @slaintecare Massive, simply massive reform needed. Also culture of aggression and blame needs to be addressed.
@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy And ftr the same cohort were vastly pro choice as well.
@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy Seeing as how 66% is a vast majority surely 75% is as well?
@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy 75% say service should not be GP led, 12% say it should, rest are unsure. Thats a survey of almost 1000 GPs.

@SimonHarrisTD As an GP I see parents all rhe time who cannot access services, specialists, pams etc without a massive fight and without spending a fortune. Historical service deficit there and wish you best of luck rectifying it.
@DrtmargTony @Berlinnaeus They are, aren't they :(
@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy And not every woman knows her LMP, most do but some have OCP failure, irreg cycles, or chaotic life circumstances.

@CathieShiels @kburnskburns @GregHughes2 @DrOKennedy Thats only one of the issues. Vast majority of GPs from day one have said clearly they do not think GP is is right or safest or best place to deliver this service. Dating a pregnancy if dates unclear is vital, as is surgery if hmg and proper contraceptive services and STI checks
@Berlinnaeus They are just wasting time and trying to piss people off.
@KilclooneyJohn That is the reality of Brexit though?
@LunchtimeLiveNT @ciarakellydoc @SallyScientist @NewstalkFM Smart arse comment but dont drink....
@astaines @HSELive They are waiting for this cold snap to end so can get a bikini clad model to launch it....
@camurphy21 @Startdoctors @FergalBowers @IrishTimes @ICGPnews @susmitchellSBP A safe secure service is needed, less political grandstanding and more planning and talking to stakeholders
RT @camurphy21: Time to move the conversation..., 66% + voted #werepealedthe8th. Letâ€™s talk to those #WewillProvide. Help training, guideliâ€¦
@JosephGall4gher 9 out of 10, not enough cat videos
@FionaKenny1 @IrishTimes Maybe they want to give airmiles?
@Madser2002 @campaignforkate @ciarakellydoc @Startdoctors If one place is a target for protesters surely any and everyone ia as well?
@dmcbfs Someone who can claim expenses for entertaining.....
@Madser2002 @campaignforkate @ciarakellydoc @Startdoctors I meant in reply to you post, HSE are going to list the name of every provider. Opens us all to every nutcase.
@KilclooneyJohn @NigelDoddsDUP @JoniLou01 The lesson being don't trust the DUP to honour a confidence and supply agreement
@maximus_hoggus If he is let, remember Wiggins wasnt even allowed start it again
@campaignforkate Any reply to the feedback? GPs were never consulted or agreed to this and the vote was not to deliver a GP led service. Safe and quality service needed.
@Madser2002 @campaignforkate @ciarakellydoc @Startdoctors HSE are going to list the name and address of every provider , this is going to be a problem.
RT @HealthTechReads: 14% of males & 26% of female surgeons report they're either abusing or dependent upon drugs or alcohol (@UW). This mayâ€¦

@campaignforkate @ciarakellydoc But GP's were not and never have been on board with a GP led service ? Even vast majortity of Pro Choice GP's feel it would be a better quality service in a dedicated setting with supports as needed.
@Berlinnaeus @IrishTimes There is no rational need for that info, maybe they want to get "slut2 tattooed on womens foreheads too ???

@Berlinnaeus @IrishTimes That amendment is distasteful on many levels. GP's and Doctors would talk that information as a matter of course in the history but it is confidential, no business at all of those lads or their cronies
@DerSchwarzBaron If there were not inconsistencies after 50 years you would be concerned
@Berlinnaeus @IrishTimes 21st century filibustering

@astaines @RTENewsAtOne @MedisecIreland And its now 4th Dec and not much will happen between 24th and 31st Dec. so less than 3 weeks for all this to be in place? Any GP's signing contracts atm needs their head examined.

@astaines @RTENewsAtOne I think he is shockingly naive, says GP small study groups will teach it, to date they haven't and the Dec ones are not about it. Other HSE courses not even available yet, no USS access yet, no pathways to hosp care yet, no clarity if @MedisecIreland will indemnify.
@LunchtimeLiveNT @ciarakellydoc @IllSueYa @offtheball That question was really quite unbelievable, even if she'd been asked after wards in a less formal Q+A would have been a disgrace..
RT @ciara_a_nolan: â€˜Dr Peter Boylan warned â€œinevitably, there will be problems and nobody should expect perfectionâ€ at the startâ€™ðŸ¤”No guidelâ€¦
@oceanclub Predator rocks on every level, "I don't have time to bleed"
@drdhanlon Half Arsed Care, the Irish solution to all Irish problems......
@drdhanlon Instead of delivering a top quality service we are rushing into it for purely political reasons.

@drdhanlon Not convinced David, I think he is too blase about the provision of supports for the services. Despite his comments this am on radio USS support is not in place and saying that complications will be dealt with by rocking up to AE is not good enough.
@GabbyLogan Seems if your face fits at the time you get it, Dwayne Chambers never got it despite being more honest and upfront than almost and other doper.
@misspollyanna @NursepollyRgn That "vigil" was a disgrace, no excuse at all for that. Once again discussion is dominated by extremes and reduced to base arguments which have been long settled.

@misspollyanna @NursepollyRgn The extremists on both sides seem intent on reducing this to rehashing the referendum. That is over, this is and should be about safe/high quality service provision. Some Docs want no abortion, some others seem to want to be providers at any cost rather than strive for the best
But, but, but .. What about the poppy.... https://t.co/0p4OjXvjHm

@misspollyanna @NursepollyRgn The meeting was a bit of a farce though and have you ever heard of an EGM where voting was not allowed? The concerns are not just from the Pro-Life docs although they are the most vocal. Most concerned ICGP has walked into providing a sub-optimal service for political expediency.
@misspollyanna @NursepollyRgn CO is not the main issue for most GP's. It access to a safe, high quality service.
@LizBarryMid @ciara_a_nolan Given previous experience, what we have at the start is the best there will be. If anything access and resources get worse after roll out. We need to get this right.

@LizBarryMid MC not ready, hospitals not ready, access to USS not ready but sure lets all rush in head first anyway........ We need to get this right, we have a chance to set up a world class service from scratch, instead we seem to prefer to wing it....
@fdelond We are dangerously underprepared and rushing forward at the same time.
@neasaconneally Oi, what this over 40 stuff ;)
@Owen_Riches Never be ashamed of what you do, never, no matter what is is
@DrMarkMurphy Mark we have extremists in that camps playing silly buggers but arrognace and extremists at the other end coming from the ICGP. Neither are showing themselves in a good light.
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea Sorry for getting a bit ratty there.
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea It's one of the multiple reasons I gave you. And did say if we signed up for extra work would need more GP's.

@clairemariamac @SimonHarrisTD @susmitchellSBP @newschambers @FergalBowers That is a disgrace and should not happen. No excuse and members of the "public" would not be in any way affected (or tbh even know it is happening).

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea Yes and I keep telling you we have no extra capacity, especially for a new service which we are not trained for and did not expect to have it landed on us. You don't accept that and that is your right, doesn't make it any less true though.
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea TOP

@marybuckley549 @DrMaryRogan @williamhboney1 @TodaySOR As with any news story it is the extremes who get the coverage. 70% or more of GP's will be involved at some level. Most feel direct provision not something they can provide for various reasons but have no issue referring.
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea No it doesn't as they are accessed elsewhere.
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea TBF every time I address your queries you move on to another almost immediately. I think I've given you enough time already.

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea Bottom line is that you don't seem to accept that most GP's feel we are not the right people to provide it, no training, no experience, no supports in place and insurance not yet confirmed will be available. Also Nowhere else in Europe is it a GP lead service.

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea Lack of training and experience is a fairly big issue don;t you think? Also lack of access to USS if needed and no clear pathway for referrals of complications in place. LARC should be available from provider as well.

@marybuckley549 @DrMaryRogan @williamhboney1 @TodaySOR 70% or more of GP's are happy to refer women at the very least. There are a hard core of maybe 20% who will just not refer or engage at all. Of the 70% its 10-30% who will actually act as direct providers.
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea The straight answer is that it depends. Would probably need to be able to increase the number of GP's we have to be able to do that.

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea It was effectively forced on the profession and the minister of the day lied through his teeth with promises about reviews and a full new contract by june 2017. A good number of GP's did not sign up
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea Yes

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea I am very pro it but it needs to be resourced, to provide it we need a lot more GP's. Thew U6 contract has almost crucified the profession and took any capacity there was and more.
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea The is no capacity at all, any increase at all in workload cannot be facilitated
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea TOP provision is just not a routine GP service,
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea So you think I should be training for something I don't think we have the capacity for and where the clinical pathways have not yet been set up for?
@williamhboney1 @TodaySOR OK, given they have say 1000 public patients each and there are 4-5k GP's, who is going to care for the 1,000,000 patients who are suddenly without a GP?
@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea And I answered your question by telling you we do not know. If you cannot accept that as an answer I'm sorry..

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea Because you will have to do extra training and keep up to date, thats on top of an already onerous CME work load. Also will have to be prepared, even one TOP will require 3 long consults under the apparent rules. Ask how many GP's have a spare 1-2 hours in any given week?

@williamhboney1 @TodaySOR Firstly I'm pro choice so thats were I am coming from, secondly there are simply going to be a hard core who will not refer. A generation of being taught it is illegal and unethical will not vanish overnight or by coercion.

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea The numbers are a 2 way issue, too few and skill levels will not be kept up to date, too many and the capacity simply isn't there. (that assumes and its a big assumption, that all the necessary sup[ports will be in place).

@anitambyrne @TheresaNewIdea 2 issues there, GP's do not act as providers in any other European country (bar in limited circumstances if France.) We have no idea how many will seek the service? PS GP's here have zero training in TOP (zero), any training will have to be from a base of zero.
@williamhboney1 @TodaySOR Reality is some will not refer, 24 hour hotline if done properly will by pass that. 70% of GP's though happy to refer.
RT @Peter_Grinspoon: I think that a lot of people with #addiction are "lonely in a crowd" because of emotional pain, alienation, or dysfuncâ€¦
@obinson @IrPsych You'll have to change your handle to Orbinson #Illgetmycoat
@DerSchwarzBaron Oi #YNWA
@williamhboney1 That and the French take less shit than we do......

@TheresaNewIdea At the end of the day we are introducing a brand new service here and had a chance to do in a a world class way with maximum buy in from stakeholders. Instead we went for the easy option and tried to sneak it in while winging it.
@TheresaNewIdea At present we can on tell women to go to AE, and re point two. I think the polite way to describe those signing up is naive.

@TheresaNewIdea Even safer if dates are correct and we have a clear route to treatment for the 1/100 severe haemorrages.. neither are in place. Also GPs simply so over stretched no capacity for new workloads.
@LADFLEG Are you not eternally grateful to her and her colonial predecessors for creating the seperate state of Ireland? Damn the begrugery
@dwuori @PaulSherwen Not me

@TheresaNewIdea If and when referral pathways for haemorrage, same say access to dating scans etc in place this may chance but they are not and maternity hospitals feel planning to date has been substandard.

@TheresaNewIdea The views of GPs are fairly clear on this (and I'm excluding the CO/Pro life) and most do not feel GP is the best or indeed safest place to deliver this. Referral not a live issue for 70% plus despite the narrative.

@TheresaNewIdea There was no vote allowed and the ICGP board have to date ignored the views of majority of GPs on this. We lack the training, capacity and proper referral pathways. ICGP policy driven by some very odd interests.
@hugorifkind If they didnt have a writing room surely theyd be doing it wrong !!!

@jessieheels @daithigor You are aware that it is only a minority (10-30%) of GPs who are prepared to act as providers, 25-30% are COs and the rest of us are far from convinced GP is the best or safest place to provide it.

RT @Femi_Sorry: Theresa Villiers should not be allowed on TV to discuss Brexit after saying:
"There is no reason why we have to change ourâ€¦
@fdelond @IrishTimes Though we all know what the religious role should be ........
@TheresaNewIdea But they didnt meet to plan services... they met to debate the way the college has acted and were refused any votes at all, on anything....
